argument.name: upgrade.budget
argument.desc: Optional: cr spent on upgrading ship

line.comment: * UT: Experience : Jumprange to buy : Jumprange to sell
* 9 or more: Trader gets a repair at SY when damaged
* 12 or more: Trader orders Jumpdrive if not installed
* 12 or more: Trader locks stations that he picked as destination
* If Trader does not find any profitable trade runs, ship will wait for a while.
* [THIS]-> connect ship command/signal [SIGNAL_KILLED] to script 'lib.ship.signal.killed.trader' with prio 10000
* load experience value and initialize variables
* not EI restart, continue as normal
* make sure it is 0 instead of null, we want a integer not a empty string! (I think this was causing the problem...)
* first run used to show trader message only ONCE at first start ever
* reset flight time to get accurate time of active trading
* improved mk3 script installed after trader has levelled up
* need to guess total flight number based on Gained
* guess avg profit per flight to 100k. that'll make salary start at 20k
* If traders has a homebase, he's a local or sector trader. else he's a UT
* This will set the homebase of the trader to null if it has less than 50000
* credits available. Otherwise the script will not work as it cannot buy.
* Problem because trader uses money of homebase to trade.
* This behaviour can be wanted so there is a money check.
* Only write to logbook when manually launching trader
* AND only for the first time!
* = [THIS]->call script 'plugin.autotrade.writelog' : text.id=$Page arg1=200 arg2=$XML arg3=$trader arg4=$Version arg5=[THIS] timestamp=$PilotandLevel arg7=$start.sector arg8=[TRUE]
* install any uninstalled usable shields from cargo bay
* On first flight, get local and sector trader into trade area
* dockingcheck lines are executed after successfull trade run
* fuel.* names vars containing amounts of fuel
* jumps.* names vars containing ranges and jumps
* If selling fails, we still know the buy price and can use it for profit calc
* salary is set at beginning of script
* TODO: make salaries visible in trade list.
* Top Traders only work with ships in perfect conditions!
* If ship is still damaged, exceptions script will only subtract repair costs,
* if not already done so before
* repair costs have been subtracted from gain var but ship is repaired now
* only wait once if rest ware selling fails. after, sell stuff for best price
* even if making a net loss. better, than waiting all the time
* autojump and $jumpdrive.installed have already been set in subroutine update.ranges
* just need to get extra fuel for the journey
* and set minimum jump range to avoid traveling through dangerous sectors
* TODO: check for arrival, if not, throw exception
* use 20 percent of total average profit per flight as salary
* save salary to be available throughout the other scripts
* v24: outsourced route selection code (SymTec, March 2009)
* V25: Changed fuelling behavior, status displays (Gnasirator, 06.01.2012)
* v26: added moskito buying and new fuel script implemented (Gnasirator, 16.01.12)
* v30: changed fuelling to one check per jump
* v31: added possibility to set start experience (BullWinkle, 22.05.2012)
* v32: local traders now start at nearest sector in trade range (Gn 26.06.2012)
* v184: Changed version numbers, Start message appears only once at first start
* v1892: reduced salary by almost 25%, implemented check for successful trade

sval.val: Optional: cr spent on upgrading ship
UT: Experience : Jumprange to buy : Jumprange to sell
9 or more: Trader gets a repair at SY when damaged
12 or more: Trader orders Jumpdrive if not installed
12 or more: Trader locks stations that he picked as destination
If Trader does not find any profitable trade runs, ship will wait for a while.
[THIS]-> connect ship command/signal [SIGNAL_KILLED] to script 'lib.ship.signal.killed.trader' with prio 10000
load experience value and initialize variables
not EI restart, continue as normal
make sure it is 0 instead of null, we want a integer not a empty string! (I think this was causing the problem...)
first run used to show trader message only ONCE at first start ever
reset flight time to get accurate time of active trading
improved mk3 script installed after trader has levelled up
need to guess total flight number based on Gained
guess avg profit per flight to 100k. that'll make salary start at 20k
If traders has a homebase, he's a local or sector trader. else he's a UT
This will set the homebase of the trader to null if it has less than 50000
credits available. Otherwise the script will not work as it cannot buy.
Problem because trader uses money of homebase to trade.
This behaviour can be wanted so there is a money check.
Only write to logbook when manually launching trader
AND only for the first time!
= [THIS]->call script 'plugin.autotrade.writelog' : text.id=$Page arg1=200 arg2=$XML arg3=$trader arg4=$Version arg5=[THIS] timestamp=$PilotandLevel arg7=$start.sector arg8=[TRUE]
install any uninstalled usable shields from cargo bay
On first flight, get local and sector trader into trade area
dockingcheck lines are executed after successfull trade run
fuel.* names vars containing amounts of fuel
jumps.* names vars containing ranges and jumps
If selling fails, we still know the buy price and can use it for profit calc
salary is set at beginning of script
TODO: make salaries visible in trade list.
Top Traders only work with ships in perfect conditions!
If ship is still damaged, exceptions script will only subtract repair costs,
if not already done so before
repair costs have been subtracted from gain var but ship is repaired now
only wait once if rest ware selling fails. after, sell stuff for best price
even if making a net loss. better, than waiting all the time
autojump and $jumpdrive.installed have already been set in subroutine update.ranges
just need to get extra fuel for the journey
and set minimum jump range to avoid traveling through dangerous sectors
TODO: check for arrival, if not, throw exception
use 20 percent of total average profit per flight as salary
save salary to be available throughout the other scripts
v24: outsourced route selection code (SymTec, March 2009)
V25: Changed fuelling behavior, status displays (Gnasirator, 06.01.2012)
v26: added moskito buying and new fuel script implemented (Gnasirator, 16.01.12)
v30: changed fuelling to one check per jump
v31: added possibility to set start experience (BullWinkle, 22.05.2012)
v32: local traders now start at nearest sector in trade range (Gn 26.06.2012)
v184: Changed version numbers, Start message appears only once at first start
v1892: reduced salary by almost 25%, implemented check for successful trade
